text: alright watch how easy this is we're
gonna prep our berries I have a pint of
strawberries half a pint of fresh
blackberries I'm going to sprinkle some
sugar over that's 1/3 of a cup and the
juice of half an orange now what's going
to happen here in the refrigerator is
the juice of the orange is going to melt
the sugar the sugar is going to pull
some of the liquid out of the berry and
in 2 or 3 hours you're gonna have a
really a good amount of berry syrup at
the bottom of this bowl you could leave
this overnight you'll get even more
juice come out of it but a couple hours
this minimum is gonna be fine I mean in
a pinch you could use it just like this
but the longer it sits the the more
juice you're gonna get out of there and
that's that to prep our mascarpone
cheese mixture we're going to zest a
lemon which is impossible to do without
a zester okay so get yourself on these
little zester is it's got these little
tiny circular blades at the end and if
you drag it across the surface it just
takes off the zest which is just that
first layer of a citrus where all the
oils and flavors are make sure you mince
that really fine you don't want chunks
of zest it's just too strong to bite
into the minced fine it gives it amazing
lemon scent to this dish there's a
teaspoon all right in a bowl you're
going to add as some softened mascarpone
all right that's just an Italian cream
cheese same cheese used in terribie soup
all right so I left that out for about a
half hour before I started just to make
it nice and easy to work with and it's
an 8 ounce container
all right you're gonna add your lemon
zest and just a half a teaspoon of sugar
because the berries are gonna be pretty
sweet
that are going to go around this final
mixture once we brulee it we don't want
the cheese mixture to be too sweet so
this is about a half a teaspoon of sugar
and that's all you're gonna need and I
finish this off with a couple drops of
vanilla that's optional but I'm showing
you the tube gourmet styles of you know
there's your Madagascar and there's your
Tahitian so that was in more of a
Tahitian mood so I put a couple drips of
that in and that just gets all mixed
together now I want you to note how soft
this mixture is and needs to be pretty
soft so we can spread it out into our
short case without tearing them all
right so you don't want to refrigerate
this give it a good mix make sure all
that zest is evenly distributed and then
we're ready to to top our short cakes
what I have here is basically just two
store-bought short cakes I've actually
done this with scones before our plain
scone which worked out pretty nice so
any Shortcake type item that has this
kind of texture will work I'd stay away
from the real spongy angel food type
base as you see for strawberry shortcake
some time and I just split those short
cakes down the middle which made four
halves and I'm teach one we are going to
spread some of our mascarpone mixture
now how much you put out here is really
going to be up to you I divided my
mixture into four which gave me two
ounces of cheese per I mean that sounds
like a lot but hey if you need a piece
of cheesecake in a restaurant you're
eating way more cheese than that so you
decide if you want to make this half the
size you can get eight halves and just
spread an ounce on each the exact same
recipe will work but I went with two
ounces per I just spread it doesn't have
to be perfect in fact it's a little
irregular it even looks nicer at the end
all right I put one on a plate
and I'm going to take a teaspoon of
granulated sugar and I'm gonna sprinkle
it right on top now here's the fun part
you're gonna get yourself a little creme
brulee blowtorch if you don't have one
already you go to a Bed Bath & Beyond or
on this website this is $19 really easy
to use nothing to be afraid of all right
keep doing from the kids of course and
what happens here the granulated sugar
you fire it with this blowtorch and it
melts right on the surface and this is
really what's gonna confuse your foodie
friends they're gonna think you bake
these little individual cheesecake type
things and you didn't this is literally
30 seconds with the torch the sugar
melts and then solidifies and you get a
nice crunchy crust on top all right I
put that in a shallow bowl and to finish
we take our delicious berries with that
nice natural cert that came out and just
surround it and there you have what I
think is just a really beautiful
delicious summer dessert
the shortcake is going to soak up that
juice and again if you tap the spoon on
the top you actually can hear the crunch
of the of the sugar so this is a really
nice interesting dish don't tell anyone
how you made it and enjoy
